item.title: Michael add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Each night, when I go to sleep, I die. And the next morning, when I wake up, I am reborn." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michael add a quote by Rutherford B. Hayes
item.description: "Personally I do not resort to force--not even the force of law--to advance moral reforms. I prefer education, argument, persuasion, and above all the influence of example." -- Rutherford B. Hayes

item.title: Michael add a quote by Margaret Mead
item.description: "Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed, citizens can change the world. Indeed, it is the only thing that ever has." -- Margaret Mead

item.title: Michael add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "If you judge people, you have no time to love them." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Michael add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Michael add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "The legitimate powers of government extend to such acts only as are injurious to others. It does me no injury for my neighbor to say there are twenty gods or no god. It neither picks my pocket nor breaks my leg." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Michael add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michael add a quote by Sam Harris
item.description: "The president of the United States has claimed, on more than one occasion, to be in dialogue with God. If he said that he was talking to God through his hairdryer, this would precipitate a national emergency. I fail to see how the addition of a hairdryer makes the claim more ridiculous or offensive." -- Sam Harris

item.title: Michael add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "The Bible tells us to be like God, and then on page after page it describes God as a mass murderer. This may be the single most important key to the political behavior of Western Civilization." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Michael add a quote by Harvey Milk
item.description: "The fact is that more people have been slaughtered in the name of religion than for any other single reason. That, that my friends, that is true perversion!" -- Harvey Milk

item.title: Michael add a quote by Edmond de Goncourt
item.description: "If there is a God, atheism must seem to Him as less of an insult than religion." -- Edmond de Goncourt

item.title: Michael add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi
